job_title: Adjunct Assistant Professor in Boston, MA
pros: Faculty and staff support each other and the students on a case by case basis. Truly a community of individuals where everyone is free to be themselves and explore a wide range of artistic disciplines. Big on interdisciplinary practice and story-telling with a robust writing curriculum that works in tandem with other departments. Despite its small size, it keeps up with the times. Montserrat has overhauled the foundations program to expose students a smorgasbord of art-making processes and a framework for making and talking about art from several disciplines. Five-minute walk to a beautiful beach. This is also the only place I’ve worked where adjuncts can apply for titles, which is a great perk if you aspire to a full-time position. Responsive and knowledgeable computer tech staff to help with inevitable glitches too.
cons: Small school means pay is on the low side, but it’s competitive with non-unionized schools in the area. Students don’t always do the work if they don’t feel like it, which slows down the momentum of classes.
